fields.title: About Sunlight Labs
fields.content:
#### What is Sunlight Labs?

Sunlight Labs started as a Sunlight Foundation [pilot project](http://blog.sunlightfoundation.com/2006/05/10/launching-sunlight-labs/) to prototype tech ideas to improve government transparency and political influence disclosure. Now we're an [open source development team](http://sunlightlabs.com/blog/2008/12/19/labs2/) that builds technology to make government more transparent and accountable. We also provide technical support to [Sunlight Foundation](http://sunlightfoundation.com) sponsored projects.

Basically, we are people that get to play around with cool data and technology every day. Want a [job](http://transparencyjobs.com) doing the same thing?

#### So you just put data from Excel spreadsheets onto Google maps?

Not at all! A lot of effort goes into making government data useful. Most of the data that the government publishes is very messy. Names of people and organizations are often spelled differently across databases. Dates and numbers are formatted differently. Obscure codes are used differently between nearly identical records. To make matters worse, much of the data that Congress is required to publish is contained in unparseable PDFs or in books in small rooms in the Capitol building.

Making government data usable is hard work!

We also spend a lot of time finding ways to make data useful to the general public. Staring at spreadsheets is boring and confusing. Data has to be presented in a way that is intriguing, visually appealing, and easy to understand.

#### Who works in the Labs?

Coders, designers, database people, a really smart systems engineer, and [burrito](http://twitter.com/welldressed/) fans.

#### Do you have lab coats?

Yes, we do.

fields.title: Sunlight Labs' Ignite Presentation
fields.content:
This presentation is open source, feel free to take it and give it in your area to help spread the word.
Ignite Presentation

fields.title: Join Sunlight Labs
fields.content:
We need your help in opening up America. Please join us. Here are the things you can do to be a part of our community.

1. Join the [Sunlight Labs Google Group](http://groups.google.com/group/sunlightlabs)
2. Follow [sunlightlabs](http://twitter.com/sunlightlabs) on Twitter.
3. Check out our [source code on GitHub](http://github.com/sunlightlabs)
4. Help contribute to our [wiki](http://wiki.sunlightlabs.com)

Thanks for participating. We're happy to have you be part of Sunlight Labs.
